member.name: M:OrchardCore.Environment.Cache.CacheContext.WithExpiryOn(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Defines the absolute time the value should be cached for. If not called a sliding value will be used.

member.name: M:OrchardCore.Environment.Cache.CacheContext.WithExpiryAfter(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Defines the absolute time (relative from now) the value should be cached for. If not called a sliding value will be used.

member.name: M:OrchardCore.Environment.Cache.CacheContext.WithExpirySliding(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Defines the sliding expiry time the value should be cached for. If not called a default sliding value will be used (unless an absolute expiry time has been specified).

member.name: M:OrchardCore.Environment.Cache.CacheContext.AddContext(System.String[])
member.summary: Defines a dimension to cache the shape for. For instance by using "user" each user will get a different value.

member.name: M:OrchardCore.Environment.Cache.CacheContext.RemoveContext(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a specific context.

member.summary: Provides the discriminator for a specific cache context by requesting all implementations.

member.name: T:OrchardCore.Environment.Cache.ICacheContextProvider
member.summary: Returns a set of values describing the discriminators of the context and a value which changes whenever the state of the discriminator changes, for instance a serial number of a timestamp.

member.summary: Adds the given dependencies to the current innermost cache context

member.name: M:OrchardCore.Environment.Cache.ICacheScopeManager.AddContexts(System.String[])
member.summary: Adds the given contexts to the current innermost cache context

member.name: T:OrchardCore.Environment.Commands.CommandReturnCodes
member.summary: Different return codes for a command execution.

member.name: M:OrchardCore.Environment.Commands.Parameters.CommandParser.SplitArgs(System.String)
member.summary: Implement the same logic as found at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/17w5ykft.aspx The 3 special characters are quote, backslash and whitespaces, in order of priority. The semantics of a quote is: whatever the state of the lexer, copy all characters verbatim until the next quote or EOF. The semantics of backslash is: If the next character is a backslash or a quote, copy the next character. Otherwise, copy the backslash and the next character. The semantics of whitespace is: end the current argument and move on to the next one.

member.summary: Executes the provided delegate and updates the cache, the whole being done atomically and after the session is committed, this only if a lock can be acquired (default timeout to 10s), and atomically if the lock doesn't expire (default to 10s).
